solution_line_template: Two white socks cost 25 cents more than a single brown sock, meaning a brown sock is sold at ${cost_two_white_socks}-${price_difference}=${cost_single_brown_sock}
The cost of buying {num_brown_socks} brown socks is {num_brown_socks}*${cost_single_brown_sock}=$<<{num_brown_socks}*{cost_single_brown_sock}={total_cost_brown_socks}>>{total_cost_brown_socks}
